([[Melbourne]], [[Australia]]; 22 May 1991) | Largest win = {{Flag icon|New Zealand}} New Zealand 11 - 0 [[American Samoa national soccer team|American Samoa]] {{Flag icon|ASA}}
([[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]; 1 January 2004) | Largest loss = {{Flag icon|New Zealand}} New Zealand 0 - 5 [[Australia national under-23 football team|Australia]] {{Flag icon|Australia}}
([[Adelaide]], [[Australia]]; 1 January 1996) | Olympic apps = 1 | Olympic first = 2008 | Olympic best = 1st Round | Regional name = [[OFC Men's Championship]] | Regional cup apps = | Regional cup first = | Regional cup best = }} The '''New Zealand Under-23 Football Team''', informally known as the "Oly-Whites", represents [[New Zealand Football]] and [[New Zealand]] in international Under-23 [[football (soccer)]] events, such as the [[Summer Olympics]]. The Oly-Whites qualified for the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics|2008 Summer Olympics]] in [[Beijing]] after winning the [[2008 OFC Olympic Qualifying Tournament|OFC Preliminary Competition]] in [[Fiji]]. Beijing was the first Olympic appearance for a New Zealand men's football team. ==Competition Record== ===OFC=== ====By Tournament==== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" !colspan=10|[[OFC Olympic Qualifying Tournament|OFC U-23 Championship]] |- !width=120 |Year !width=60 |Round !width=60 |{{Tooltip| Pld | Played}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| W | Won}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| D | Drawn}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| L | Lost}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| GF | Goals for}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| GA | Goals against}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| GD | Goal difference}} !width=60 |{{Tooltip| Pts | Points}} |- |[[1984 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|1983-84]]||Group Stage||8||3||1||4||8||10||-2||10 |- |[[1988 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|1987-88]]||3rd Place||8||4||1||3||24||7||+17||13 |- |{{Flag icon|FIJ}} [[1992 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|1992]]||Runners-up||6||4||1||1||12||6||+6||13 |- |{{Flag icon|AUS}} [[1996 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|1996]]||Runners-up||8||6||0||2||28||9||+19||18 |-bgcolor=gold |{{Flag icon|NZL}} [[1999 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|1999]]||Champions||9||4||0||5||23||17||+6||12 |- |{{Flag icon|AUS}}{{Flag icon|NZL}} [[2004 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|2004]]||Runners-up||6||4||1||1||17||4||+13||13 |-bgcolor=gold |{{Flag icon|FIJ}} [[2008 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|2008]]||Champions||5||5||0||0||19||3||+16||15 |- | [[2012 OFC Men's Olympic Football Tournament|2012]]|||||||||||||||||| |- |'''Total'''||||'''50'''||'''30'''||'''4'''||'''16'''||'''161'''||'''56'''||'''+105'''||'''94''' |- |} ====By Match==== =====2004===== {{footballbox collapsible |date=14 January 2004 |time='''Group Stage''' |team1={{fb|NZL}} |score=9 â 0 |team2={{fb|Cook Islands}} |goals1=[[Brent Fisher (footballer)|Fisher]] {{goal|30}} {{goal|55}} {{goal|59}}
